medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset abdominal pain accompanied by nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began yesterday afternoon while eating a salad, characterized by a large amount of nonbloody emesis and lower midline abdominal pain without radiation. Patient reports similar pain to previous SBOs; also experienced diarrhea at the same time as nausea and vomiting. No shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, urinary symptoms, or back pain noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on Coumadin, multiple SBOs, abdominal gunshot wound managed conservatively, osteoarthritis, cerebrovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, diastolic CHF with Lasix dependence, chronic kidney disease stage III, gout, obstructive sleep apnea on CPAP, colonic polyps status post excision, diverticulosis, hemorrhoids, osteoarthritis of left knee, morbid obesity.
medical_history.social_history: Denies alcohol intake for a number of years and any drug use.
